title: Concept: Trie (Prefix Tree)
content: A Trie is a tree where each node represents a character. Useful for 'startsWith' queries. Each node has `children: Map<char, Node>` and `isEnd: boolean`.

title: Concept: Trie + DFS
content: For Word Search problems, build a Trie from the dictionary. Then DFS the grid. If the current path's prefix is not in the Trie, prune the search immediately.

title: Concept: System Design in Algo
content: Understand constraints. Read-heavy? Optimize `get`. Write-heavy? Optimize `put`. Memory constrained? Use compact structures.

title: Concept: The Linked Hash Map
content: The secret to O(1) LRU/LFU. Use a HashMap for O(1) access to keys, and a Doubly Linked List for O(1) updates to the 'order' (move to head/tail).

title: Concept: Randomized O(1)
content: To delete from an array in O(1), you must know the index. Map value -> index. To delete without gaps, Swap the target with the Last element, then Pop.
